metadata.description: Cutaneous reflex arcs mediating superficial, withdrawal, and temperature-dependent responses to skin stimuli.
metadata.notes: Catalogues skin-triggered reflex behavior without duplicating actuator tuning from the biomimetic registry.

abdominal_skin.afferent: Thoracoabdominal cutaneous afferents to T7-T12 dorsal horn neurons.
abdominal_skin.integration: Segmental interneuron circuits projecting to ipsilateral motor pools.
abdominal_skin.effector: Localized abdominal wall contraction drawing umbilicus toward the stimulus.

cremasteric.stimulus: Gentle stroking of the superior inner thigh.
cremasteric.afferent: Femoral branch of the genitofemoral nerve to L1-L2 segments.
cremasteric.integration: Spinal interneurons coupling sensory input to ipsilateral motor outflow.
cremasteric.efferent: Genital branch of the genitofemoral nerve.
cremasteric.effector: Elevation of the testis via cremaster muscle contraction.

plantar_surface.stimulus: Cutaneous stimulation along the lateral plantar surface.
plantar_surface.integration: Polysynaptic plantar reflex circuitry modulating toe flexors and extensors.
plantar_surface.efferent: Medial and lateral plantar motor branches.
plantar_surface.effector: Toe flexion with suppression of extensor hallucis unless corticospinal impairment provokes Babinski extension.

anal_wink.afferent: Pudendal nerve afferents entering S2-S4 segments.
anal_wink.effector: External anal sphincter contraction producing visible wink.

scapular.afferent: Dorsal thoracic cutaneous nerves to C5-T1 segments.
scapular.integration: Spinal interneurons linking cutaneous input to scapular stabilizers.
scapular.efferent: Dorsal scapular and accessory motor pools.
scapular.effector: Scapular adduction toward the stimulated side.

nociceptive_withdrawal.stimulus: Acute painful cutaneous insult to distal extremity.
nociceptive_withdrawal.afferent: A-delta and C nociceptors entering multisegmental interneuron networks.
nociceptive_withdrawal.integration: Flexor reflex afferent pathways coordinating limb flexion and inhibition of antagonists.
nociceptive_withdrawal.effector: Rapid limb withdrawal away from stimulus.

crossed_extensor_cutaneous.stimulus: Cutaneous pain afferents triggering ipsilateral withdrawal.
crossed_extensor_cutaneous.afferent: Commissural interneurons distributing nociceptive input to contralateral segments.
crossed_extensor_cutaneous.integration: Spinal networks sustaining contralateral extensor activation while ipsilateral flexors engage.
crossed_extensor_cutaneous.effector: Extension and weight support on the opposite limb.

flexor_withdrawal_synergy.stimulus: Broad cutaneous noxious stimulation such as stepping on a sharp surface.
flexor_withdrawal_synergy.afferent: High-threshold cutaneous afferents to propriospinal interneurons.
flexor_withdrawal_synergy.integration: Coordinated recruitment of hip, knee, and ankle flexors with suppression of extensors.
flexor_withdrawal_synergy.effector: Multijoint flexion removing the limb from danger.

cold_withdrawal.stimulus: Sudden contact with freezing or near-freezing surface.
cold_withdrawal.afferent: Cold-sensitive A-delta fibers routed through dorsal horn lamina I.
cold_withdrawal.integration: Spinal interneuron network biasing flexor activation and autonomic thermogenic responses.
cold_withdrawal.efferent: Flexor motor neurons with sympathetic support.
cold_withdrawal.effector: Withdrawal of the contacted region accompanied by thermogenic priming.

heat_withdrawal.stimulus: Touching a hot surface above nociceptor threshold.
heat_withdrawal.afferent: Heat-sensitive C fibers synapsing in superficial dorsal horn.
heat_withdrawal.integration: Fast polysynaptic circuitry engaging flexors while damping extensors.
heat_withdrawal.effector: Immediate withdrawal from heat source to limit tissue damage.

light_tactile_startle.stimulus: Unexpected light touch to face or distal extremity.
light_tactile_startle.afferent: Low-threshold mechanoreceptors projecting via trigeminal or dorsal column pathways.
light_tactile_startle.integration: Brainstem reticular circuits coupling cutaneous input to axial motor nuclei.
light_tactile_startle.efferent: Facial, cervical, and limb motor neurons.
light_tactile_startle.effector: Brief orienting startle-like contraction or blink.
